com.projetloki.genesis.image

Class MathFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.image.MathFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hashable

    public abstract class MathFunction
extends Object
implements Hashable
    A function from [0, 1] to [0, 1].

    Functions are immutable. It means that all the methods transforming a function, e.g. flipX(), don't actually modify the function but return a new function which is the result of the transformation.

    All methods return serializable functions as long as this and the arguments are serializable.

    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    MathFunctions, Gradient.transform(MathFunction)

      • get

        public abstract double get(double x)
        Returns the function value at x.
        Parameters:
        x - the input. Must be between 0 and 1.
        Returns:
        the output. Must be between 0 and 1.

      • flipX

        public final MathFunction flipX()
        Returns the function obtained by flipping horizontally the graph of this function. The new function satisfies f'(x) = f(1 - x)

        f f.flipX()

      • flipY

        public final MathFunction flipY()
        Returns the function obtained by flipping vertically the graph of this function. The new function satisfies f'(x) = 1 - f(x)

        f f.flipY()

      • compose

        public final MathFunction compose(MathFunction g)
        Returns the composition of the two functions. The new function satisfies f'(x) = f(g(x))

        f g f.compose(g)

      • hashCode

        public final int hashCode()

        hashCode in class Object
